Package DSA_Resit

Class CircularLinkedList

java.lang.Object
DSA_Resit.CircularLinkedList
public class CircularLinkedList extends Object
This is a representation of the data structure Circular Linked List. The nodes (ShopNode) are linked in one direction, with links to both head and tail.

  • Field Details

    • head

      public ShopNode head
      This is the start of the list.

      If size = 0, both head and tail will be null.
      If size = 1, it will point to the tail.
      If size > 1, it will point to the next ShopNode in list.

    • tail

      public ShopNode tail
      This is the end of the list.

      If size = 0, both tail and head will be null.
      If size = 1, it will point to the head.
      If size > 1, it will still point to the head.

  • Constructor Details

    • CircularLinkedList

      public CircularLinkedList()
      Initialises the list.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether the list is empty or not.
      Returns:
      Boolean

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the size of the list.
      Returns:
      Integer

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the list and resets size to 0.

      Does not explicitly delete the ShopNode objects, they are collected by Java's garbage collection.

    • insertNode

      public void insertNode​(ShopNode node, int pos)
      Inserts a node between the head and tail of the list.
      Parameters:
      node - ShopNode that is being inserted.
      pos - is the index of the list that ShopNode will be inserted in, must be between 0 and size for this to execute.

    • addToHead

      public void addToHead​(ShopNode node)
      Adds a node to the head of the list.

      If the list is empty, it will also set tail to the new node.

      Parameters:
      node - ShopNode

    • addToTail

      public void addToTail​(ShopNode node)
      Adds a node to the tail of the list.

      If the list is empty, it will also set head to the new node.

      Parameters:
      node - ShopNode

    • removeFromTail

      public void removeFromTail()
      This removes a node from the tail of the list.

    • removeFromHead

      public void removeFromHead()
      This removes a node from the head.

      Sets the next node to be the new head. If there is non, is will clear both head and tail.

    • printList

      public void printList()
      This outputs all the ShopNodes that is currently stored in the list by invoking ShopNode.toString().
